intro: Chaeturus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. These plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of broad, lance-shaped leaves and their showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The flowers are usually green or reddish in color and are clustered in umbels, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. Chaeturus species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in moist, woodland habitats and are known for their ornamental value in gardens.
